Description: Mould-made pottery lamp with a double-convex body, a flat-topped nozzle with a splayed end and a curved tip, and a raised circular base, defined by a groove and flat below. The sunken discus has a raised edge and groove. The shoulder is decorated with convex panels divided by radiating raised lines grooved on each side. The top of the nozzle is decorated with short parallel grooves, and at the junction with the shoulder are linked volutes, giving the effect of an Ionic column.
Bibliographic references: Lamp / Catalogue of the Lamps in the British Museum (Q599)
Acquisition name: Donated by: Mrs W N Weech
